attributes.action: We need changes when it comes to the universities during the pandemic.
attributes.additional_details: We want to attend our lectures on the campus as normally since our university social life has been taken away from us unfortunately because of the pandemic. My question is why are most of the working places, primary and secondary schools are normally open in which there is a much higher risk of contamination than universities? That's why we want these changes. If these changes can't be applied to this situation then we think that it would be sensible to decrease the courses' fees by a certain proportion according to the situation and negotiations
attributes.background: We want the government to let us students attend our university lectures on the campus as normal if not the fees for the courses must decrease by a certain percentage.

rejection.details:
Universities are autonomous institutions and it is up to individual universities, not the Government or House of Commons, to decide to how to deliver courses during the pandemic.

We have published the following petitions regarding tuition fees, which you might like to sign:

Require universities to partially refund tuition fees for 20/21 due to Covid-19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324762

Lower university tuition fees for students until online teaching ends: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/552911

Government subsidise this year's university tuition fees: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/552814
